title: The Most Epic Drone Farm Tour | by Farmer Brad

subtasks: Approach the pile of bags
Lift a bag off the pile
Take hold of the bag with both hands
Raise the bag vertically to shoulder height
Walk towards the truck
Position the bag near the truck's loading area
Lower the bag onto the truck bed
Secure the bag on the truck bed if necessary
Approach the truck's loading area
Lift a bag from the truck bed
Take hold of the bag with both hands
Lower the bag to the ground
Move the bag from the truck to the designated drop-off point
Place the bag gently at the drop-off location
Repeat for all remaining bags

tasks.task: Moving along the row of crops
subtasks: Walk along the crop row
Identify plants that need to be tended
Bend down towards the ground to inspect plant health
Straighten up and determine necessary actions
Walk towards the identified plant
Kneel down beside the plant
Perform weeding or pruning as needed
Stand up after completing the task
Move to the next plant
Step into the cab of the combine harvester
Secure seatbelt if present
Adjust control levers for speed
Monitor the direction of the combine
Identify rows of crops to harvest
Maneuver the combine to approach the crop row
Engage the cutting blades
Maintain a steady speed through the field
Collect harvested crops into the combine's bin
Disengage when nearing the end of the row
Drive towards the next row
Repeat the process for each row

tasks.task: Unloading harvested crops from the combine
subtasks: Drive the combine to the designated unloading area
Shift gears to put the combine in a lower speed or neutral
Remove the auger or conveyor belt from the combine
Position the auger or belt near a trailer or storage bin
Begin unloading the crops by directing them into the storage
Monitor the flow of crops to avoid jamming
Adjust the direction as needed
Secure any loose material after unloading
Approach the livestock area
Open the gate to the livestock enclosure
Distribute feed from a container
Stand near the animals and observe their eating
Close the gate after feeding is complete

tasks.task: Checking the barn for structural integrity
subtasks: Walk around the barn perimeter
Inspect the roof for any missing tiles or leaks
Check walls for cracks or instability
Examine the foundation for settling or damage
Look for loose nails, screws, or boards
Document any issues found for repair
Park the tractor in a wash bay or appropriate area
Turn off the engine and wait for it to cool
Rinse the exterior with a hose
Apply soap to the body of the tractor
Scrub the dirt and grime from the metal surfaces
Rinse the soap off thoroughly
Dry the tractor with a clean cloth or towel
Check areas like windows and mirrors for streaks
Get the pesticide applicator ready
Mix the pesticide according to the label instructions
Load the solution into a sprayer or applicator
Walk along the crop rows, spraying the solution
Maintain a consistent pattern to cover the entire area
Check for escapees or no-spray zones
Properly clean and dispose of equipment afterward

tasks.task: Checking the water supply for irrigation
subtasks: Go to the irrigation system's main valve
Open the valve to start water flow
Walk through the field to check for proper distribution
Look for any leaky pipes or blockages
Close the valve if the check is complete
Document any issues requiring maintenance

tasks.task: Operating a baler to collect bales
subtasks: Drive the baling machine to the field
Position the machine near a harvested crop
Engage the baling mechanism
Watch for the completion signal to discharge the bale
Transport the bale to the storage area
Repeat until all desired bales are collected

tasks.task: Checking the silo for stored feed
subtasks: Climb the ladder to reach the silo top
Inspect the feed level inside the silo
Look for any spoiled or moldy feed
Note the need to refill as necessary
Descend from the silo safely
Identify the broken part
Locate replacement parts in the shed
Remove the damaged component
Install the new part, securing it properly
Test the tractor to ensure everything is working
Go to the aquarium or fish pond
Open the container of pellets
Scoop an appropriate amount into your hand
Gently pour the pellets into the water
Observe the fish to ensure they are eating

tasks.task: Prepping a new row for planting
subtasks: Remove existing vegetation from the row

Inspect belts, chains, and tensioning mechanisms
Lubricate parts that require it
Tighten any loose connections

Walk the perimeter of the farm
Visually inspect the irrigation lines for breaks or damage

Mark or report any leaks needing repair

tasks.task: Attaching a trailer to the truck

tasks.task: Using the water pump to irrigate

Place the bag gently at the drop-off location
Repeat for all remaining bags

tasks.task: Moving along the row of crops
subtasks: Walk along the crop row
Identify plants that need to be tended
Bend down towards the ground to inspect plant health
Straighten up and determine necessary actions
Walk towards the identified plant
Kneel down beside the plant
Perform weeding or pruning as needed
Stand up after completing the task
Move to the next plant
Step into the cab of the combine harvester
Secure seatbelt if present
Adjust control levers for speed
Monitor the direction of the combine
Identify rows of crops to harvest
Maneuver the combine to approach the crop row
Engage the cutting blades
Maintain a steady speed through the field
Collect harvested crops into the combine's bin
Disengage when nearing the end of the row
Drive towards the next row
Repeat the process for each row

tasks.task: Unloading harvested crops from the combine
subtasks: Drive the combine to the designated unloading area
Shift gears to put the combine in a lower speed or neutral
Remove the auger or conveyor belt from the combine
Position the auger or belt near a trailer or storage bin
Begin unloading the crops by directing them into the storage
Monitor the flow of crops to avoid jamming
Adjust the direction as needed
Secure any loose material after unloading
Approach the livestock area
Open the gate to the livestock enclosure
Distribute feed from a container
Stand near the animals and observe their eating
Close the gate after feeding is complete

tasks.task: Checking the barn for structural integrity
subtasks: Walk around the barn perimeter
Inspect the roof for any missing tiles or leaks
Check walls for cracks or instability
Examine the foundation for settling or damage
Look for loose nails, screws, or boards
Document any issues found for repair
Park the tractor in a wash bay or appropriate area
Turn off the engine and wait for it to cool
Rinse the exterior with a hose
Apply soap to the body of the tractor
Scrub the dirt and grime from the metal surfaces
Rinse the soap off thoroughly
Dry the tractor with a clean cloth or towel
Get the pesticide applicator ready
Mix the pesticide according to the label instructions
Load the solution into a sprayer or applicator
Walk along the crop rows, spraying the solution
Maintain a consistent pattern to cover the entire area
Check for escapees or no-spray zones
Properly clean and dispose of equipment afterward

tasks.task: Checking the water supply for irrigation
subtasks: Go to the irrigation system's main valve
Open the valve to start water flow
Walk through the field to check for proper distribution
Look for any leaky pipes or blockages
Close the valve if the check is complete
Document any issues requiring maintenance

tasks.task: Operating a baler to collect bales
subtasks: Drive the baling machine to the field
Position the machine near a harvested crop
Engage the baling mechanism
Watch for the completion signal to discharge the bale
Transport the bale to the storage area
Repeat until all desired bales are collected

tasks.task: Checking the silo for stored feed
subtasks: Climb the ladder to reach the silo top
Inspect the feed level inside the silo
Look for any spoiled or moldy feed
Note the need to refill as necessary
Identify the broken part
Locate replacement parts in the shed
Remove the damaged component
Install the new part, securing it properly
Test the tractor to ensure everything is working
Go to the aquarium or fish pond
Open the container of pellets
Scoop an appropriate amount into your hand
Gently pour the pellets into the water
Observe the fish to ensure they are eating

tasks.task: Prepping a new row for planting
subtasks: Remove existing vegetation from the row
Till the soil to prepare planting beds
Apply fertilizer or compost as needed
Smooth the soil surface with a rake
Mark the planting rows with a line for consistency
Open the combine’s hood or access panel
Inspect belts, chains, and tensioning mechanisms
Lubricate parts that require it
Tighten any loose connections
Check for any parts that need replacement
Approach a stall in the barn
Remove manure or soiled bedding
Power wash or sweep the stall floor
Replace fresh bedding if necessary
Ensure the stall is dry before reusing
Walk the perimeter of the farm
Visually inspect the irrigation lines for breaks or damage
Feel along the lines for warmth indicators of leaking water
Mark or report any leaks needing repair

tasks.task: Attaching a trailer to the truck
subtasks: Go to the truck and trailer
Secure the trailer hitch to the truck trailer mount
Ensure the coupling is properly aligned
Check connections and safety chains
Verify the trailer is secure
Walk along the grapevine rows
Identify vines that need pruning
Use pruning shears to cut dead or excess wood
Dispose of pruned branches properly
Apply any necessary pesticides or fungicides
Enter the chicken coop
Distribute feed from a hopper
Provide water from a waterer
Check for any sick or injured chickens
Close the coop door securely

tasks.task: Loading bales onto the hay wagon
subtasks: Approach the bale pile
Lift a bale with both hands
Carry the bale to the hay wagon
Place the bale carefully on the wagon
Secure the bale on the wagon if necessary
Repeat until all bales are loaded

tasks.task: Attaching a plow to the tractor
subtasks: Go to the plow and tractor
Align the plow’s hitch with the tractor’s coupler
Secure the hitch pins
Tighten any bolts or levers
Confirm that the plow is steady and level
Test movement to ensure everything is correctly attached
Walk to the prepared planting row
Hold the corn seed container
Insert the corn seeds into the ground at the correct depth
Cover the seeds with soil
Repeat for each planted row
Open the toolbar on the combine
Loosen any screws or bolts to adjust settings
Modify the toolbar for optimal performance based on the crop type
Retighten the adjusted settings
Approach a pen or area with pigs
Choose a pig to shave
Apply shaving cream to the pig's legs
Use a razor to carefully remove hair from the legs
Clean any shaving areas and ensure no cuts

tasks.task: Using the water pump to irrigate
subtasks: Start the water pump located in the barn
Connect the irrigation lines to the pump output
Operate the pump to provide water to the field
Monitor water pressure and distribution
Turn off the pump when done

tasks.task: Operating a sprayer to apply mulch
subtasks: Fill the sprayer with mulch material
Drive the sprayer through the rows of crops
Spray the mulch evenly over the ground
Check the application rate and coverage
Clean and store the sprayer after use

tasks.task: Replacing a broken window in the barn
subtasks: Find the broken window pane
Remove any existing window trim or surrounding materials
Measure the window frame for the new glass
Purchase or obtain a replacement pane
Remove old caulking or sealant
Install the new glass pane, ensuring it fits correctly
Reattach any trim pieces and apply new sealant if needed
Empty the tank a small amount at a time
Use a net or siphon to remove debris
Check for any fish health issues
Clean any algae buildup on the tank walls
Refill the tank with clean water
Walk along the prepared rows for tomatoes
Hold the tomato plant seedling
Dig a hole at the correct spacing
Place the seedling into the hole, partially burying it

tasks.task: Adding a mulch layer to crops
subtasks: Select a suitable mulching material, such as straw or bark
Load the mulch into the spreader
Push the spreader through the rows of crops
Distribute the mulch evenly along the rows
Check for consistent coverage
Locate drainage tiles in the field
Clear any blockages or sediment buildup in the tiles
Remove debris or roots from the tile openings
Check connections for leaks or misalignment
Seal any gaps or cracks to maintain proper drainage
Go to the garden plot where squash will be planted
Prepare the soil by loosening and removing weeds
Dig small holes at the appropriate spacing
Place squash seedlings into the holes, partially burying them
Water the planting area to settle the soil
Collect fresh manure from the livestock area
If necessary, compost the manure to reduce odor and pathogens
Spread the manure in a thin layer over the garden beds
Cultivate the manure into the soil to integrate it
Approach the dairy barn
Open the barn door and enter
Check each cow for signs of health issues
Milk the cows if the barn is equipped for milking
Clean stalls and ensure water and feed are available
Secure the barn door before exiting
Go to the chicken coop
Open the coop door
Carefully retrieve the eggs from beneath the chickens
Place the eggs in a basket or container
Close the coop door after collecting
Transport the eggs to the desired location

tasks.task: Checking the feed troughs for animals
subtasks: Walk around the farm checking various animal enclosures
Open feed troughs or dispensers

Remove any spoiled feed that could attract pests
Check water sources for each animal group
Prepare the fertilizer in a spreader
Walk the crops in the designated pattern, applying the fertilizer
Check the coverage and adjust as necessary
Dispose of any leftover fertilizer according to guidelines
Go to the lettuce plots in the garden

Place harvested lettuce in a basket or cooler to maintain freshness

Walk through the tomato rows

Use tools like trowels or weeders to remove weeds
Ensure not to damage tomato roots during removal

tasks.task: Planting cover crops in unused fields
subtasks: Prepare the field by tilling the soil

Turn off the tractors and drain fuel lines if needed
Apply lubricant to exposed metal parts to prevent rust
Store equipment in a dry place, covering if necessary
Drain water from irrigation systems and drain hoses
Go to the livestock area or feeding areas

Distribute the treated feed to the animals
Enter the animal stall area

tasks.task: Operating a chisel plow to break up soil

Monitor the soil to check for clumping or unevenness

tasks.task: Storing harvested crops in a barn
subtasks: Take harvested crops from the field

Select a suitable mulching material, such as straw or bark

Apply a layer of mulch 2-3 inches deep around plants

tasks.task: Building a fence around a garden
